intro: Canthium viridissimum, commonly known as the green-headed spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, characterized by its distinctive greenish-yellow flowers. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Canthium viridissimum is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands.
